definition: station/to stand/to halt/to stop/branch of a company or organization/website
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
to take possession of/to occupy/to take up
a power station/an electricity generating plant

sentences.english: Anne closed her book and stood up.
Standing on the starting line, we're all cowards.
sentences.chinese: 站在起跑線上，我們都是膽小者。

sentences.english: It stands apart with small creatures near its roots.
sentences.chinese: 它站在這裏，與樹下的小動物保持着距離。

sentences.english: We stood there listening to our own breathing.
sentences.chinese: 我們站在那裏聆聽着我們自己的呼吸聲。

sentences.english: But I try to be close to her.
sentences.chinese: 但是我會努力站在她身邊。

sentences.english: The scheme is mainly composed of center station and substation.
sentences.chinese: 方案由調度中心站和子站組成。

sentences.english: But here I am and there you are and it is the moment of and for Veritas.
sentences.chinese: 但是，我還是要站在這兒，跟你們聊聊。

sentences.english: At the same moment, he perceived a pale girl standing before him.
sentences.chinese: 他看見一個面色蠟黃的姑娘站在他面前。

sentences.english: Metro line 2 to century avenue Station, about 10 min walk to the hostel.
sentences.chinese: 坐地鐵2號線世紀大道站下，步行10分鐘到旅舍。

sentences.english: Why standest thou afar off, O LORD?
sentences.chinese: 耶和華阿，你爲什麼站在遠處。

sentences.english: The terminal of the train is BAGOU.
sentences.chinese: 本次列車終點站是巴溝站。

sentences.english: I stand in front of the calendar disappointed for a long time and a sense of desolation over my heart.
sentences.chinese: 我站在掛曆前悵然了很久，一種蒼涼的感覺漫過心頭。

sentences.english: When you find yourself losing focus, get up and take a walk.
sentences.chinese: 當你發現自己開始注意力不集中，你可以站起來走走。

sentences.english: Is the office near public transport, either the subway or a bus station?
sentences.chinese: 新辦公室離公共交通工具，地鐵或者公共汽車站近嗎？

sentences.english: She stood with her back to him, staring at the back wall of his house.
sentences.chinese: 她站在那兒，背對着他，目光注視着房子的後牆。

sentences.english: Mrs. Castle was invariably standing there on the porch waiting for her son.
sentences.chinese: 卡斯爾夫人總是站在門廊上等兒子。

definition: terminus/final stop on rail or bus line
to change train (plane, bus etc)/transfer between modes of transport
departure (of a coach or train)/to dispatch a vehicle
bus or tram stop/intermediate stop (on route of ship, plane etc)/port of call/stopover
stop (on a bus or train route)
to put a new bus or railway station into operation
public transportation/mass transit/abbr. for 公共交通[gong1 gong4 jiao1 tong1]
